com.tdgame
Class Screen

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  com.tdgame.Screen
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class Screen
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.lang.Runnable

This class is responsible for controlling the life cycle of the application, it contains the method to create, load and save a map based upon the dimensions entered by the user. This class is also responsible for controlling the life cycle of the towers on the map. IMPORTANT: 1) For external resources we are using relative path. For eg, "../level/Base.xml" 2) The width and height of the applet should be set to the screen size manually by going into 'Run Configurations > Parameters'. This would be changed into a browser driven applet that would display the applet dynamically.

Version:
$revision
Author:
Team 2
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

createMap

public void createMap()
This method is called when the user wants to create a map. It would ask the user to enter dimensions of the map and the filename with which he wants to save the map.

loadMap

public void loadMap()
This method is called when the user wants to load an existing map A list of existing files will be displayed and the user will chose the files to be loaded as per his wish

                      java.lang.String typeOfOperation,
                      User user)

Parameters:

placeTower

public boolean placeTower(int xPos,
                          int yPos,
                          java.lang.String new_towerText)
This method is called when user drags a tower and leaves the mouse button to place tower on the map

Parameters:
xPos - x-position of the tile
yPos - y-position of the tile
new_towerText - type of tower
Returns:
boolean returns True, if the tower was successfully placed, else, returns False
